## addScreenReaderTextListener() function

Registers a listener function to be called each time a new message is coming from the screen reader.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function addScreenReaderTextListener(webdriver: WebdriverLike, fn: (message: string) => void, scope?: any): () => void;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  webdriver | [WebdriverLike](./assistive-webdriver.webdriverlike.md) | reference to the selenium-webdriver instance |
|  fn | (message: string) =&gt; void | function to register as a listener. The message read by the screen reader is passed as the first (and only) parameter. |
|  scope | any | scope to use when calling the listener |

<b>Returns:</b>

() =&gt; void

a function to unregister the listener

## Remarks

The function may not be called immediately after the screen reader reads a message. Messages are retrieved from the assistive-webdriver server only when [refreshScreenReaderText()](./assistive-webdriver.refreshscreenreadertext.md) is called, and that is when the listeners are called if new messages are retrieved.
